page.title: 06AMENITIES & SOCIAL LIFE
page.content: AMENITIES AND SOCIAL LIFE. There are no amenities and little in the way of social life in the area itself. The Wynnstay Kennels have kept foxhounds since 1749 and the Wynnstay Hunt still continues but attracts mainly people from outside the area. There is also a private pheasant shoot.The local ''point to point'' was ended in 1937. There is one public house in the area and three just outside.There is a caravan park in the area which is much used . There are branches of the Women's Institute at Erbistock and Eyton.There is no doctor's surgery or police station now.All the local shops have closed over the last ten years.There is only one shop, the Erbistock Post Office serving the area.The Penylan and Erbistock schools have closed.Children go to Eyton school by bus.
